byline.contributor: Katie Thomas and Carlos Tejada contributed reporting.

abstract: Federal regulators bar Theranos chief executive Elizabeth Holmes from owning or operating medical laboratory for at least two years following scrutiny over effectiveness of technology and way company operated its labs; unusually strict order raises new questions about future of troubled blood-testing start-up and Holmes.
lead_paragraph: Regulators also revoked the operating license of a Theranos lab and levied a fine. The sanctions were a major setback for the blood-testing start-up.

headline.main: Elizabeth Holmes of Theranos Is Barred From Running Lab for 2 Years
headline.print_headline: Theranos Chief Is Barred From Running a Lab

snippet: Regulators also revoked the operating license of a Theranos lab and levied a fine. The sanctions were a major setback for the blood-testing start-up....
